IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY, SAFE, CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE, FINANCIALLY AND PHYSICALLY ACCESSIBLE HEALTH SERVICES TO THE MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AND PERSONS OF ALL AGES WHO COME TO US FOR CARE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTIVE AND PRIMARY HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO THE CITIZENS OF THE GREATER HARTFORD AREA.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDE PRIMARY HEALTH CARE TO AREA RESIDENTS REGARDLESS OF THEIR CURRENT PERSONAL FINANCIAL SITUATION AND ABILITY TO REPAY BENEFITS PROVIDED TO THEM.

Activity2.Description: PROVIDE PRIMARY MENTAL HEALTH CARE & COUNSELING SERVICES, AS WELL AS PROVIDE PRESCRIPTION MEDICATIONS TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE SURROUNDING AREA.

Activity3.Description: PROVIDE PRIMARY DENTAL CARE TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE SURROUNDING AREA.

ActivityOther.Description: PROVIDE PRIMARY CARE TO THE HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN THE SURROUNDING AREA.

NameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: ST FRANCIS HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENTER

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: DURING 2010, THE CENTER WAS REQUIRED TO ADOPT CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF FASB ASC 740, "INCOME TAXES", WHICH PROVIDE A NEW FRAMEWORK FOR HOW COMPANIES SHOULD RECOGNIZE, MEASURE, PRESENT AND DISCLOSE UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS IN THEIR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WITH THESE CHANGES, THE CENTER MAY RECOGNIZE THE TAX BENEFIT FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED ON EXAMINATION BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. THE TAX BENEFITS RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FROM SUCH POSITION ARE MEASURED BASED ON THE LARGEST BENEFIT THAT HAS A GREATER THAN 50% LIKELIHOOD OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. THE CENTER DID NOT RECORD ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AS OF AND FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010. THERFORE, THE CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF FASB ASC 740, WHICH WERE ADOPTED DURING 2010, HAD NO IMPACT ON THE CENTER'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: THE CENTER'S PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER SERVES ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER ASSOCIATION OF CONNECTICUT (CHCACT), WHOSE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS COMPOSED OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVES FROM CERTAIN CONNECTICUT COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS. GRANT AND CONTRACT REVENUE PROVIDED BY CHCACT TO THE ORGANIZATION TOTALED $103,708 FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

THE CENTER'S PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER ALSO SERVES ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF COMMUNITY HEALTH NETWORK OF CT, INC. (CHN). THE CENTER HAS AN INVESTMENT IN CHN, WHICH TOTALED $83,333 AS OF JUNE 30, 2010. CONTRACT REVENUE PROVIDED BY CHN TO THE ORGANIZATION TOTALED $1,088,567 FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010. AMOUNTS DUE FROM CHN AMOUNTED TO APPROXIMATELY $172,000 AS OF JUNE 30, 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CFO AFTER IT HAS BEEN PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE CPA FIRM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANY DIRECTOR OR OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION WHO HAS AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN AN ENTITY, OR WHO HAS FINANCIAL INTEREST IN A CONTRACT, THAT IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE THEREOF FOR AUTHORIZATION, APPROVAL OR RATIFICATION, SHALL DISCLOSE SUCH PERSON'S INTEREST TO THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE PRIOR TO ITS ACTING ON ANY MATTER INVOLVING SUCH ENTITY OR CONTRACT. SUCH DISCLOSURE SHALL INCLUDE ANY RELEVANT AND MATERIAL FACTS KNOWN TO SUCH PERSON ABOUT THE CONTRACT WHICH MIGHT REASONABLY BE CONSTRUED TO BE ADVERSE TO THE ORGANIZATION'S INTEREST. THE PERSON'S ABSTENTION FROM THE VOTE AND THE REASON FOR IT WILL BE RECORDED IN THE MINUTES OF ANY MEETING AT WHICH SUCH MATTERS ARE DISCUSSED. FURTHER, NO DIRECTOR OR OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION SHALL HAVE ANY OBLIGATIONS TO ANY EMPLOYER, OTHER PERSON OR ORGANIZATION THAT WILL INTERFERE WITH THE DIRECTOR'S OR OFFICER'S PERFORMANCE AS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE ORGANIZATION OR WHICH WILL RESULT IN ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S INTEREST. WHILE SERVING AS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, DIRECTORS OR OFFICERS AGREE NOT TO ENGAGE IN ANY ACTIVITY INCONSISTENT WITH THE DIRECTOR'S OR OFFICER'S OBLIGATIONS TO THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES THE SERVICES OF A COMPENSATION CONSULTING COMPANY TO REVIEW THE SALARY LEVELS OF THE EXECUTIVES OF THE ORGANIZATION, BY UTILIZING INDUSTRY STANDARDS. THE SALARY RANGES FOR EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE DETERMINED BASED UPON INDUSTRY AVERAGES. COMPENSATION IS ADJUSTED ANNUALLY BASED ON PERFORMANCE REVIEWS PREPARED BY SUPERVISORS AND REVIEWED BY THE CEO. THE LAST PERFORMANCE REVIEW OCCURRED DURING THE SPRING OF 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE FINANCE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEARS.
